docs.title: Setting up a dev container for Go
Prerequisites
docs.text:
• VS Code with Dev Containers extension
  • Docker installed and running
  • Git installed
  • Knowledge of terminal

docs.title: Project Initialization
docs.text:
# Create Project Directory
mkdir comp423-go
cd comp423-go

# Initialize Git Repository
git init

docs.title: Create Go Project
docs.text:
Initialize the Go module 

go mod init hello-comp423

docs.title: Implement Hello World
docs.text:
Create a file main.go in the root of your project. 

package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
    fmt.Println("Hello COMP423")
}

docs.title: Run Subcommand
docs.text:
By typing in the command below, it will compile the file and run the program. 

go run main.go

docs.title: Build Subcommand
docs.text:
By typing in the first command below, it will create an executable in your project directory. Then, typing in the second command, you will be able to run the program 

go build -o hello main.go
./hello
